section.heading: Definitions.

content.p: ï¿½Amusement parkï¿½ means any permanent facility or park where amusement rides are available for use by the public. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Amusement rideï¿½ or ï¿½rideï¿½ means any type of ride, including, without limitation, any mechanical or aquatic device which carries passengers over a fixed or restricted route primarily for the passengersï¿½ amusement. The terms include any ride propelled by its passengers or gravity if it is located in an amusement park. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Operatorï¿½ means a person who owns, leases, manages or operates an amusement park. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Passengerï¿½ means a person using an amusement ride.

section.heading: Operators: Duty to ensure safety of passengers.

content.p: An operator shall take all measures reasonably necessary to ensure the safety of the passengers in constructing, maintaining, operating and supervising an amusement ride.

section.heading: Operators: Posting and maintenance of certain signs.

content.p: An operator shall prominently post and maintain in at least five conspicuous locations in the amusement park, including each entrance, exit, station for reporting an injury and first-aid station, signs that: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Indicate the responsibilities of operators and passengers pursuant to the provisions ofNRS 455B.010to455B.100, inclusive. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Inform passengers of the location of stations for reporting accidents. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An operator shall prominently post and maintain signs in simple and concise language at or near points where passengers embark upon an amusement ride, directing persons who are not familiar with the operation of the ride to ask an authorized agent or employee of the operator for assistance and instruction.

section.heading: Passengers: Duties.

content.p: Heed warnings and other information posted by an operator or announced by an authorized agent or employee of an operator; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Conduct himself or herself in such a manner as to avoid injury to persons and property in an amusement park.

section.heading: Passengers: Prohibited conduct generally.

content.p: Embark upon an amusement ride when the passenger knows that he or she has insufficient knowledge or physical ability to use the ride safely; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Purposefully embark upon or disembark from an amusement ride, except at the time and area designated for such a purpose or at the direction and under the direct supervision of an authorized agent or employee of an operator; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Fail or refuse to comply with instructions given to the passenger by an authorized agent or employee of an operator regarding the use of an amusement ride; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Conduct himself or herself in a manner that could interfere with the safe operation of an amusement ride or with the safety of another passenger.

section.heading: Passengers: Prohibited manipulation of amusement ride.

content.p: When using an amusement ride that requires a passenger to steer or control the ride in some manner, a passenger shall not steer or control the ride in a manner which intentionally harms another. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A passenger shall not disable or attempt to disable any safety or restraining device. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A passenger shall not alter or enhance the intended speed, course or direction of an amusement ride.

section.heading: Passengers: Persons deemed trespassers; access to controls of amusement ride; assumption of risks.

content.p: A person who boards an amusement ride without authority or without paying the appropriate consideration shall be deemed to be a trespasser. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A passenger shall not attempt to gain access to the controls of an amusement ride designed to be operated by an authorized employee or agent of an operator. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A passenger who has attained the age of 13 years shall be deemed to have knowledge of and assume the inherent risks of an amusement ride to the extent that as those risks are open and obvious to the reasonable person.

section.heading: Use of alcohol or controlled substance by passenger: Prohibition; authority of agent of operator.

content.p: A passenger shall not embark on an amusement ride while intoxicated or under the influence of a controlled substance, unless in accordance with: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions ofchapter 678Cof NRS. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An authorized agent or employee of an operator may prohibit a passenger from boarding an amusement ride if he or she reasonably believes that the passenger is under the influence of alcohol, prescription drugs or a controlled substance. An agent or employee of an operator is not civilly or criminally liable for prohibiting a passenger from boarding an amusement ride pursuant to this subsection.

section.heading: Reporting of personal injuries sustained on amusement ride.

content.p: A passenger who sustains a personal injury on a ride shall make a written report concerning the details of the incident, unless the injuries are so severe that they prevent the passenger from being able to make such a report. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An operator shall ensure that there are designated stations to report any injuries which occur. The stations must be staffed during regular business hours. The location of any such stations must be included in the notices posted pursuant to subsection 1 ofNRS 455B.030. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A report filed pursuant to this section must contain: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The name and address of the person injured; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A brief description of the incident; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The cause of the injury, if known; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The names and addresses of any witnesses to the incident. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the injured person is unable to file a report because of the severity of the personï¿½s injuries, the report must be filed as soon as practicable, but in no event later than 120 days after the incident. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Reports filed pursuant to this section must be maintained by the operator for at least 3 years after the date of the injury described in the report and must be available for inspection by the injured person or the authorized agent of the injured person during regular business hours.

section.heading: Effect of provisions governing amusement parks on local ordinances.

content.p: The provisions ofNRS 455B.010to455B.100, inclusive, do not prohibit a county, city or unincorporated town from adopting ordinances that regulate amusement parks which are consistent with the provisions ofNRS 455B.010to455B.100, inclusive.

section.heading: Definitions.

content.p: As used inNRS 455B.200to455B.300, inclusive, unless the context otherwise requires, the words and terms defined inNRS 455B.210to455B.250, inclusive, have the meanings ascribed to them in those sections.

section.heading: ï¿½Roller skateï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Roller skateï¿½ means a tandem or in-line set of wheels mounted on a frame that can be fitted to the sole of a shoe or a shoe mounted on a tandem or in-line set of wheels.

section.heading: ï¿½Scooterï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Scooterï¿½ means a tandem or in-line set of wheels mounted on a board or frame with a steering handle which is not propelled by a motor.

section.heading: ï¿½Skateboardï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Skateboardï¿½ means a tandem or in-line set of wheels mounted on a board.

section.heading: ï¿½Skateboard parkï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Skateboard parkï¿½ means a park or part of a park with paths, slopes, structures, jumps and other areas open to the public that are designated for use with a skateboard, roller skates, a bicycle or a scooter.

section.heading: ï¿½Skateboard park operatorï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Skateboard park operatorï¿½ means an agency or political subdivision of this state that owns, controls, operates or manages a skateboard park.

section.heading: Prohibited conduct generally.

content.p: Fail or refuse to comply with: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Reasonable instructions provided by an authorized agent or employee of a skateboard park operator regarding the use of the skateboard park; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Intentionally place, drop or throw any object in the path of a user of a skateboard park or on the surface of a skateboard park; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Conduct himself or herself in a manner that interferes with the safe operation of a skateboard park or with the safety of other users of a skateboard park.

section.heading: Duties of person using skateboard park.

content.p: Locate and ascertain the meaning of any sign that is posted in or near the skateboard park by the skateboard park operator; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Avoid impeding or colliding with other skateboarders, roller skaters, bicyclists and operators of scooters when entering any part of the skateboard park and when commencing to skateboard, roller skate, ride a bicycle or operate a scooter from a stationary position; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Maintain a proper awareness and control of the personï¿½s speed to avoid colliding with objects and other users of the skateboard park; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Conduct himself or herself in such a manner as to avoid injury to persons and property in the skateboard park.

section.heading: Reporting of personal injury sustained while using skateboard park; liability of skateboard park operator; duty to minimize dangers.

content.p: A person who sustains a personal injury while the person is using a skateboard park shall notify the skateboard park operator or an authorized agent or employee of the operator of the injury as soon as reasonably possible. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A skateboard park operator is not liable for the death or injury of a person or for damage to property caused or sustained by a person using a skateboard park who knowingly enters an area which is not designated for use with a skateboard, roller skates, a bicycle or a scooter. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A skateboard park operator shall take reasonable steps to minimize dangers and conditions within the operatorï¿½s control.

section.heading: Use of skateboard park while intoxicated or under influence of controlled substance prohibited; information to be reported when collision or accident results in injury to another person; penalty.

content.p: A person shall not enter or use a skateboard park to skateboard, roller skate, ride a bicycle or operate a scooter while intoxicated or under the influence of a controlled substance, unless in accordance with a lawfully issued prescription. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A person using a skateboard park who is involved in a collision or an accident in which another person is injured shall provide his or her name and current address to the injured person and the skateboard park operator or an authorized agent or employee of the operator: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Before the person leaves the vicinity of the collision or accident; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As soon as reasonably possible after leaving the vicinity of the collision or accident to secure aid for the injured person. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person who violates a provision of this section is guilty of a misdemeanor.

section.heading: Effect of provisions governing skateboard parks on local ordinances.

content.p: The provisions ofNRS 455B.200to455B.300, inclusive, do not prohibit a county, city or town from adopting ordinances that regulate skateboard parks which are consistent with the provisions ofNRS 455B.200to455B.280, inclusive.

section.heading: Definitions.

content.p: As used inNRS 455B.400to455B.490, inclusive, unless the context otherwise requires, the words and terms defined inNRS 455B.405to455B.420, inclusive, have the meanings ascribed to them in those sections.

section.heading: ï¿½Operatorï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Operatorï¿½ means a government, governmental agency or political subdivision of a government that owns, controls, operates or manages a recreation area.

section.heading: ï¿½Recreation areaï¿½ defined.

content.p: A snow recreation area as defined inNRS 455A.083; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A skateboard park as defined inNRS 455B.240.

section.heading: ï¿½Trailheadï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Trailheadï¿½ means the beginning point of a trail, including, without limitation, any facility for parking, water or sanitation that is available for use at that point.

section.heading: ï¿½Water access areaï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Water access areaï¿½ includes, without limitation, a beach, river entry or exit point and land located at or below the ordinary high-water mark of a navigable body of water within this State.

section.heading: Prohibited conduct generally.

content.p: Fail or refuse to comply with: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Reasonable instructions provided by an operator or an authorized agent or employee of an operator regarding the use of a recreation area; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Conduct himself or herself in a manner that interferes with the safe operation of a recreation area or with the safety of other users of a recreation area; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Trespass on any private property located in or adjacent to a recreation area.

section.heading: Duties of person using recreation area.

content.p: A person using a recreation area shall, to the extent possible: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Locate and ascertain: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The meaning of any sign that is posted in or near the recreation area by the operator of the recreation area; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Familiarize himself or herself with the natural conditions of the recreation area and any resulting dangerous conditions in the recreation area and any private property located in or adjacent to the recreation area; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Familiarize himself or herself with any dangerous conditions relating to an irrigation system in or near the recreation area. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person using a recreation area shall not tamper with or alter an irrigation system or any part of an irrigation system in the recreation area.

section.heading: Persons deemed trespassers; reporting of personal injury sustained while using recreation area; limitation on liability of operator and owner of private property; duty to minimize known dangers; posting of signs that provide certain information.

content.p: A person who enters a recreation area unlawfully shall be deemed to be a trespasser. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A person who sustains a personal injury while the person is using a recreation area shall notify the operator or an authorized agent or employee of the operator of the injury as soon as reasonably possible. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided by law, an operator or an owner of private property is not liable for the death or injury of a person or for damage to property caused or sustained by a person using a recreation area if the person knowingly enters an area which is located outside the recreation area. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An operator shall take reasonable steps to minimize known dangers and conditions of trailheads and water access areas within the operatorï¿½s control. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An operator shall post signs in conspicuous places or provide other information at trailheads and water access areas that: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Prescribe rules concerning safety, conduct and use; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Provide warnings about known dangerous conditions and potential hazards.

section.heading: Entering or using recreation area while intoxicated or under influence of controlled substance prohibited; exception; authority of operator or agent to prohibit entrance or use of recreation area by person under influence of alcohol, prescription drugs or controlled substance.

content.p: A person shall not enter or use a recreation area while intoxicated or under the influence of a controlled substance, unless in accordance with: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions ofchapter 678Cof NRS. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An operator or an authorized agent or employee of an operator may prohibit a person from entering or using a recreation area if he or she reasonably believes that the person is under the influence of alcohol, prescription drugs or a controlled substance. An operator or an authorized agent or employee of an operator is not civilly or criminally liable for prohibiting a person from entering or using a recreation area pursuant to this subsection.

section.heading: Information to be reported when motor vehicle crash or accident results in injury to another person; penalty for failure to report such information.

content.p: A person using a recreation area who is involved in a motor vehicle crash or an accident in which another person is injured shall provide his or her name and current address to the injured person and the operator or an authorized agent or employee of the operator: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Before the person leaves the vicinity of the crash or accident; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As soon as reasonably possible after leaving the vicinity of the crash or accident to secure aid for the injured person. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person who violates a provision of this section is guilty of a misdemeanor.

section.heading: Revocation of license or privilege to use recreation area.

content.p: An operator may revoke the license or privilege of a person to use a recreation area if the person violates any provision ofNRS 455B.400to455B.490, inclusive.

section.heading: Effect of provisions governing recreation areas on local ordinances and laws and regulations of this State.

content.p: Do not prohibit a county, city or unincorporated town from adopting ordinances that regulate a recreation area which are consistent with the provisions ofNRS 455B.400to455B.490, inclusive. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Are in addition to any provision ofchapter 407of NRS or any regulation adopted pursuant to that chapter that is applicable to a recreation area.
